alert.note: Alert for Coke; Runnels (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 3:43PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Coke and northwestern Runnels Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 342 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bronte, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Norton around 415 PM CDT. Wingate around 430 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Wilmeth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
